msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.l: And the divine Presence of Lord appearedto Abraham in the plain lands of Mamre,and he sat at the door of his tent just in the heat ofthe day.
And he raised his eyes and looked,and, lo, three men stood close to him. And he saw,and he ran to meet them from the tent door,and bowed himself to the ground.
And said, ‘Oh Lord,if now I have found favour in your sight, I prayyou, may your divine Presence not pass by your servant.’
Andhe said to the men, ‘Take a little water, andwash your feet, and lean against |the tree| under the tree.
And let me get a morsel of bread, that you may strengthen your hearts.Afterward you will pass on and go — when you have passed by your servant.’And they said, ‘Do as you have spoken.’
And Abraham hurried to the tentto Sarah, and said, ‘Hurry, knead three seahs of fine flourand make cakes.’
And Abraham ran to the cattleand took a calf, young and good, andgave it to a young man, and he hastened to do it.
And he took butter, and milk, and the calf which he hadprepared, and set it before them. And he stoodbefore them under the tree, and they did eat.
And they said to him, ‘Where is Sarah your wife?’ And he said,‘Lo, she is in the tent.’

And he said, ‘I will surely returnto you about this time next year, to a healthy |you|, and, lo,Sarah your wife will have a son.’ And Sarah was listening while standing at the tent door,and the door was behind the angel.
And Abraham and Sarah were old,well along in days of old age; it had ceased to be with Sarahafter the way of women.
So Sarah laughedwithin herself, saying, ‘After I have grown oldI got youth, and my lord is old.’
And⟨the divine Presence of the⟩ Lord said to Abraham, ‘Why did Sarah laugh, saying,“Shall I indeed bear a child? But I grew old.”
Is anything too wondrous for the Lord? At the appointed timeI will return to you, about this time next year, to a healthy |you|, and Sarah will havea son.’
But Sarah denied, saying, ‘I did not laugh,’because she was afraid. And he said, ‘No, because you did laugh.’
Andthe men rose up from there, and looked toward Sodom.and Abraham went with them to accompany them.
And the Lord said, ‘Shall I hide from Abrahamthat thing which I do?
But Abraham shall surely becomea great and mighty kingdom, and in him shall be blessed all thekingdoms of the earth.

For I know him, that he may commandhis children and his household after him,and they shall keep the way of the Lord, to do righteousness and justice,and for the purpose of the Lord bringing upon Abraham what he spoke about him.’
And the Lord said, ‘The cry of those oppressed bySodom and Gomorrah: how great it has become. And their sinful deeds:how very grave they has become.
My providence shall go downand see whether they have sinned altogether according to the outcry that has come to me.And if not, let me know.’
And the men turnedfrom there and went to Sodom, but Abraham, he still stoodbefore the Lord.
And Abraham approached,and said, ‘Will you also destroy the righteous with the wicked?
Maybethere are fifty righteous within the city. Will you also destroyand not absolve the sin of the place for the merit of the fifty righteousthat are in it?

That be far from you to doa thing like this, to kill the righteous with the wicked, so that the righteous are like the wicked!Far be that from you! Will the Judge of all the earthnot make the right judgement?’
And the Lord said, ‘If I findin Sodom fifty righteous within the city, I will absolvethe sin of all the place for their merits.’
AndAbraham answered and said, ‘Lo, now, I have decidedto speak before the Lord, and I am dust and ashes.
Maybe five of the fifty righteous are lacking. Will you destroyall the city for lack of five?’, and God said, ‘I will not destroyeven if I find forty-five there’.
AndAbraham spoke before God yet again, andsaid, ‘Maybe forty are found there.’ And God said,‘I will not punish |them| even for the sake of forty.’
AndAbraham said, ‘I pray you, let not the Lord be angry, and let me speak.Maybe thirty will be found there.’ And He said, ‘I will not punish |them|even if I find thirty there.’
AndAbraham said, ‘Lo, now, I decided to speak beforethe Lord. Maybe twenty will be found there.’ And God said,‘I will not destroy |it|, even for the sake of twenty.’

And he said,‘I pray you, let the anger of Lord be not kindled, and let me speak, but this once.Maybe ten righteous will be found there.’ And God said, ‘I will not destroy|it|, even for the sake of ten.’
And the divine Presence of the Lord went |His way|,when he had finished speaking with Abraham, and Abrahamreturned to his place.

app.note: Cf. Heb. סְאָה ‘seah, i.e. a dry and liquid measure, one third of an ephah’.
